name: places/ChIJwT52-qRZwokR_lrvCwPfr74
formattedAddress: 77 W 24th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 77 W 24th St, New York, NY 10010, USA

originalText.text: I lived here since December 2020. The building staff is absolutely amazing. They are so kind and welcoming. So many things happened in my life while I was here and they were so supportive. After coming back from vacation, it was nice to see their faces because I felt home. My favorite handyman Ezekiel always came to my apartment very quickly when requested and repaired fast but not rushed. He is very kind and friendly. I am only moving because I happen to find a bigger space. The amenities are top notch, all vanities are updated. I was proud to call this place a home. They even have a dog washing station in the building!! I LOVED this place. Highly recommend!!

originalText.text: The staff at the Vanguard go above and beyond to make your experience amazing. The front desk staff are friendly and always willing to help. The maintenance workers come quickly and get the job done with ease and little interference. It’s a wonderful place to live and I’m grateful for their assistance throughout my time there.

text.text: The staff at the Vanguard go above and beyond to make your experience amazing. The front desk staff are friendly and always willing to help. The maintenance workers come quickly and get the job done with ease and little interference. It’s a wonderful place to live and I’m grateful for their assistance throughout my time there.

originalText.text:
Vanguard Chelsea is a great pet-friendly place to live in Manhattan! The staff and 24/7 doorman service is very professional and everyone is super friendly. From attending to specific requests, organizing packages, and helping keep the building safe, the staff are always available!
Maintenance requests are addressed quickly and efficiently, often times same day, which is great!
The building has a ton of amenities, including a gym with instructor-led classes and up to date equipment which is often cleaned. Additionally, it has a great outdoor terrace with BBQ grills, a billiards room, a children's playroom, and a lounge area.
The building is often cleaning common areas and hallways, even the sidewalk outside and is very responsive to any ad-hoc requests.
The building is conveniently located within minutes of many grocery stores, dry cleaners, coffee shops, and much more. The leasing office is also great, and even showed me my apartment virtually with detail before I committed because I was unable to make it in person to view it.
If you're looking for a safe, comfortable, and luxurious place to stay in the Flatiron/Chelsea district, Vanguard Chelsea is a great option!

originalText.text:
I have lived at The Vanguard going on seven years. It feels like home in every respect. Shout out to Yesenia, our leasing agent, for being so kind, and such source of support and tenacity.

There is no place I would rather be.

From the new lobby renovations to the terrific outdoor terrace (prime for relaxing with a book or working on a laptop, getting some sun or drinking wine with friends) to the best-in-class fitness center and classes offered such as yoga...the Vanguard is the place I am happy to call home.

Not to mention..the 23rd street subway is a block away, Madison Square Park right down the street and some of the best restaurants in NYC abound around us. For example, The Smith is a stone's throw away and my go-to spot.

In short, I am lucky and happy to be here and truly never want to leave!

originalText.text: I've really enjoyed living in the Vanguard the past few years. The doormen and other staff are very friendly and helpful. Maintenance is great, I rarely waited even a full day for anything to be repaired. Leasing/management office is easy to work with as well, with Yesenia in particular going above and beyond to make everything as seamless and painless as possible. Amenities are top of the line. Everything in the common spaces of the building has been fully renovated recently. Only docking a star because post-Covid price increases have been substantial (as with the rest of the NYC rental market), 6th Ave location can be a little chaotic for aging millennials such as myself who crave more peace and quiet, and construction noise/elevator shutdowns were a pain for a while but have resolved now.
